section.description: What are the advantages of using Xdialog boxes versus using a regular form object for data entry?

case.title: Xdialog:
case.description: All code. Powerful but sensitive to errors.

case.title: Forms:
case.description: Best at displaying large quantities of data, and creating a very rich visual impact.

case.title: Xdialog:
case.description: Best at all the 'small' user interface messages, picklists, routine messages, etc.

case.title: Forms:
case.description: Forms are bound to underlying tables or sets.

case.title: Xdialog:
case.description: Xdialogs are not bound to underlying tables or sets.

case.title: Forms:
case.description: Many built-in features for controlling user behavior.

case.title: Xdialog:
case.description: All events must be coded, so unplanned user behavior cannot happen.

case.title: Forms:
case.description: Distributed with the table's data dictionary.

case.title: Xdialog:
case.description: Can be bundled in a compiled .AEX library.
